summary: This is an email chain between U.S. prosecutors discussing a draft Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty (MLAT) request to France regarding a witness, likely related to the investigation of Jean-Luc Brunel. The email indicates the Paris Prosecutor's Office is willing to assist on a reciprocal basis.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email, likely from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, discussing the draft MLAT request to France regarding a witness and Jean-Luc Brunel.

persons.name: Jean-Luc Brunel
persons.context: Mentioned as the subject of a meeting between the DOJ Attaché and the Paris Prosecutor's Office. The MLAT request to France is related to him.

connections.description: The U.S. prosecutor is involved in an investigation concerning Jean-Luc Brunel, as evidenced by the discussion of an MLAT request to France related to him.

events.title: DOJ Attaché Meeting with Paris Prosecutor's Office
events.description: The DOJ Attaché met with the Paris Prosecutor's Office about Jean-Luc Brunel, indicating a willingness to assist based on an MLAT request.

events.title: Draft MLAT Request to France
events.description: U.S. prosecutors circulate a draft Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty request to France regarding a witness related to the Brunel investigation.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: U.S. prosecutors are preparing an MLAT request to France regarding a witness in an investigation connected to Jean-Luc Brunel.
The Paris Prosecutor's Office has indicated willingness to assist the U.S. investigation of Brunel on a reciprocal basis.
The communication shows ongoing international cooperation in the Epstein/Brunel investigations as of early 2021.
